description: Creates a queue to coordinate the order in which jobs run on a farm. A queue can also specify where to pull resources and indicate where to output completed jobs.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The unique token which the server uses to recognize retries of the same request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: farmId
parameters.description: The farm ID of the farm to connect to the queue.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: The display name of the queue.

parameters.name: jobAttachmentSettings
parameters.description: The job attachment settings for the queue. These are the Amazon S3 bucket name and the Amazon S3 prefix. The Amazon S3 bucket name. The root prefix.

parameters.name: jobRunAsUser
parameters.description: The jobs in the queue run as the specified POSIX user. posix (dict) --- The user and group that the jobs in the queue run as. The name of the POSIX user. The name of the POSIX user's group. windows (dict) --- Identifies a Microsoft Windows user. The user. The password ARN for the Windows user. Specifies whether the job should run using the queue's system user or if the job should run using the worker agent system user.

nested_params.name: posix
nested_params.description: The user and group that the jobs in the queue run as.

nested_params.name: user
nested_params.description: The name of the POSIX user.

nested_params.name: group
nested_params.description: The name of the POSIX user's group.

nested_params.name: passwordArn
nested_params.description: The password ARN for the Windows user.

nested_params.name: runAs
nested_params.description: Specifies whether the job should run using the queue's system user or if the job should run using the worker agent system user.

parameters.name: requiredFileSystemLocationNames
parameters.description: The file system location name to include in the queue. (string) ---

parameters.name: allowedStorageProfileIds
parameters.description: The storage profile IDs to include in the queue. (string) ---

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Each tag consists of a tag key and a tag value. Tag keys and values are both required, but tag values can be empty strings. (string) --- (string) ---
